Dear Mr. Derscheid:
Attached is the Interim Inspection Report for the above referenced agency completed on
May 1, 2025. Due to the violations of applicable licensing rules, a written corrective action
plan is required. The corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and
must include the following:
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result in
compliance.
• How compliance with each citation will be achieved.
• Specific time frames for each citation as to when the correction will be completed
or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is achieved.
If you fail to submit an acceptable corrective action plan, disciplinary action may result.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager Jessica VandenHeuvel at 616-204-6992.
Sincerely,
Stephanie S Meeuwenberg, Licensing Consultant

III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
The agency is in compliance with all applicable rules and statutes except for the following:
CCI Rule 400.4108 Financing and audit
• (1) A licensee shall do all of the following:
• (a) Obtain an annual audit of all financial
accounts. Audits for nongovernmental
institutions shall be conducted by an
independent certified public accountant
2

who is not administratively related to the
agency.
The facility is undergoing a third-party financial audit for 2022, and has not begun
the process for 2023 or 2024.

VI. EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD
Maltreatment in Care
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this licensing
period.
Corrective Action Plan Compliance
The agency has submitted 2 acceptable corrective action plans (CAP) during this
licensing period, and compliance with each individual CAP is as follows:
4

2024 Renewal Audit: Corrective Action Plan was recorded during this reporting
period as a result of the Renewal Inspection completed on May 14, 2024. This
CAP contained five violations, including CCI Rule 400.4155 in that two of four
initial service plans were not uploaded in MiSACWIS as required; CCI Rule
400.4156 in that three of four updated services plans were not uploaded into
MiSACWIS as required; CCI Rule 400.4145 in that six youth files reviewed did not
have physical exams uploaded into MiSACWIS as required; CCI Rule 400.4147 in
that six youth files reviewed did not have the youth’s dental documentation
uploaded in MiSACWIS as required; and CCI Rule 400.4108 in that the third-party
financial audit was not completed as required. The facility successfully completed
the corrective action steps for CCI Rules 400.4155, 400.4156, 400.4145, and
400.4147 as all documentation was uploaded into MiSACWIS and kept updated
until the facility no longer was required to utilize MiSACWIS for record keeping.
The facility worked cooperatively with the financial institution to obtain the third-
party audit however it is still in progress.
Special Investigation 2024SIC0001374 with CAP approval date of September 17,
2024, was a result of a violation for Resident Work Experience. The facility sent a
memo to all staff outlining the rule, reviewed the rule during an all-staff meeting,
provided quarterly reminders to staff for 12 months, and developed a work project
verification sheet for any work projects youth complete. The facility completed all
steps in this action plan by January 27, 2025.
Financial Overview
There are no financial concerns identified based on the review of the facility's
budget. The Agency's annual third-party audit report is in process for 2022 and has
not begun for 2023 or 2024. The Chief Administrator reported there has been
several issues in obtaining the audit, however they are working cooperatively with
the financial institution in order to get it completed. The financial institution reported
that the facility is providing them with the documents they require to complete the
audit, and they expect to be finished with the 2022 audit by the end of May 2025.
The 2023 financial audit will be completed by end of August 2025, and the 2024
financial audit will be completed by end of November 2025.
PREA compliance (if applicable)
N/A
Chief Administrator Assessment
The Chief Administrator assessment was reviewed. The Chief Administrator
reported all aspects of CAP’s during the period under review were completed
successfully with the exception of the ongoing work to obtain third-party financial
audits. Chief Administrator reported the Thrive and Quest Programs are doing well,
and unplanned discharges have decreased significantly. The Quest program has
had 24 successful graduates for the year, the length of stay for youth has
decreased, and there has been an increase in family involvement. The Thrive
5

program has completed its second year and had 9 successful graduates with a low
rate of reoffending from youth. The program focuses on family involvement and has
successfully engaged caregivers in the youth’s treatment. The Chief Administrator
reported the program is going to utilize two houses for the Quest program in the
near future and will have six youth in each house.
Staff and Youth Interviews
Staff interviews were conducted during the inspection. Staff reported feeling
supported by coworkers and administration. Staff reported feeling the facility is
running smoothly and did not have any concerns.
Youth interviews were conducted during the inspection. Youth reported feeling safe
and respected by staff members. The youth did not report any concerns with the
facility or staff.
Description of Agency Walk Through
An onsite inspection and walkthrough of the facility occurred on May 1, 2025. There
were no issues or safety concerns noted.
VII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the agency is not in compliance with all applicable licensing
statutes and rules. Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it is
recommended that the agency continue on their regular license.
